trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_SEQ_00<tab>Wuk Lamat wishes to seek out the Dawnservant's elector.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_TODO_00<tab>Look around Ok'hanu.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_TODO_02<tab>Continue looking around Ok'hanu.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Alphinaud.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_KRILE_000_001<tab>Assuming we have the right idea, one of the Dawnservant's electors should be here somewhere.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ALPHINAUD_000_005<tab>One can tell at a glance how very different the Hanu culture is to the Vanu's.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ALISAIE_000_010<tab>The water from the falls must flood the wetlands and flow into all these streams and rivers...
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ERENVILLE_000_015<tab>I agreed to serve as a guide, not a nursemaid.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_020<tab>It's like our friend said. The people are in no mood for festivities...
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_KRILE_000_021<tab>I can only assume they are still recovering from the damage wrought by the storm.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_022<tab>Indeed... Well, let's do what we came to do and find this elector.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ZANUHALI_000_023<tab>(-Elderly Hanu Woman-)Ohokaliy!
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_024<tab>Oho...what now?
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ERENVILLE_000_025<tab>It's a Hanu greeting. Surely you heard it the last time you were here.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_026<tab>Well, I was busy enjoying the festival...
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ZANUHALI_000_027<tab>Greetings to the Third Promise and her entourage! I, Zanuhali, welcome you to Ok'hanu.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ZANUHALI_000_028<tab>As elder of my people, I shall also be fulfilling the duties of elector during the rite of succession.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_029<tab>So our idea about the electors was correct. We just do as Papa said, and retrace his path from the saga!
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_030<tab>I'm ready! Give me the feat and test my worth!
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ZANUHALI_000_031<tab>All in good time, all in good time. In fact, I came to let you know that we are not quite ready to begin.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ZANUHALI_000_032<tab>For the moment, please enjoy the hospitality of our village.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_033<tab>Should we poke around a bit, then? We might pick up some clues about the feat. You know, prepare ourselves.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ALISAIE_000_034<tab>That's surprisingly prudent of you.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_035<tab>What! You think I'm being too cautious!?

TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ALISAIE_000_036<tab>No, no, I'm impressed, is all. You admire and respect your father, who is prone to decisive action, so I expected you to rush in first and ask questions later. Or never.

TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_037<tab>I do look up to Papa, but you should know that he has a pragmatic side too. The Head of Reason is the thinker who takes time to consider all the possibilities.

TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_038<tab>With the long naps he takes these days, though, the Head of Resolve is less restrained by his wisdom. I can't fault you for thinking that's all there is to him, but there's more to the Dawnservant you've seen thus far.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ALPHINAUD_000_039<tab>I should like to speak with the Head of Reason one day.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_040<tab>Ah, well...I'm sure you'll catch him awake soon enough.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ERENVILLE_000_041<tab>To return to the subject at hand, you wish to take a look around Ok'hanu, then? Do some groundwork before the feat begins?
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_042<tab>Something like that. I mean, I could probably pass this test with my eyes closed, but it'll keep us busy while we're waiting!
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ALPHINAUD_000_043<tab>Wuk Lamat has the right of it. As Elder Zanuhali is a resident of this village, learning more about it can only improve our chances in the feat.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_044<tab>Right, then. It helped to do some investigating at Wachunpelo, so let's take a look around here as well!
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ALPHINAUD_000_045<tab>Might I suggest a division of forces? For instance, Erenville, Alisaie, and Krile could concentrate on the southern half of the settlement.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ALPHINAUD_000_046<tab>Meanwhile, Wuk Lamat, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, and myself will handle this northern half.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_047<tab>Sounds good to me!
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_050<tab>This is even worse than I expected...
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_HANUHANUNOTFEELING04866_000_055<tab><sigh>
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_HANUHANUNOTFEELING04866_000_056<tab>You heard about the storm? I've never seen the likes of it before.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_HANUHANUNOTFEELING04866_000_057<tab>With the supplies and help the Dawnservant sent, we're making progress repairing and rebuilding our homes...
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_HANUHANUNOTFEELING04866_000_058<tab>But while rooves and walls can be patched, there is so much else that was lost for good...
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_HANUHANUNOTFEELING04866_000_059<tab><sigh>
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_SYSTEM_000_060<tab>The gaping hole in the wall and missing portion of the roof are clearly the work of the storm's powerful winds. Repairs appear to be ongoing.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_HANUHANUNOTFEELING04866_000_070<tab><sigh> What are we to do...?
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_075<tab>A lot of houses are still damaged, and the Hanu I've spoken to are not their usual cheery selves. That storm broke more than wood and reeds.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_076<tab>There must be something I can do to help them...
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_077<tab>I'm going to look around a bit more.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ALPHINAUD_000_080<tab>Some manner of boat?
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_SYSTEM_000_085<tab>The dry and shrunken bundles suggest the reeds were harvested some time ago.
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_SYSTEM_000_086<tab>Woven from reeds, this boat-like vessel is reminiscent of a bird. The beak and feathered tail in particular stand out.

TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ALPHINAUD_000_090<tab>This boat must be woven from the same reeds I've seen gathered into bundles here and there. The plants hold both practical and cultural significance to the Hanu, then...
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_KRILE_000_091<tab>(-Krile-)Hello, can you all hear me?
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_KRILE_000_092<tab>(-Krile-)I'm told they're ready to receive us now. Come to the large building in the south of the village!
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_WUKLAMAT_000_093<tab>(-Wuk Lamat-)On my way!
TEXT_KINGMA107_04866_ALPHINAUD_000_094<tab>We ought to hurry over, too.
